00042 /*
00043  * Translate a symbolic debug level into a numeric code.
00044  * Also accepts valid decimal values.
00045  * @returns CCNL_ code, or 1 to use built-in default, or -1 for error. 
00046  */
00047 int
00048 ccnr_msg_level_from_string(const char *s)
00049 {
00050     long v;
00051     char *ep;
00052     
00053     if (s == NULL || s[0] == 0)
00054         return(1);
00055     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "NONE"))
00056         return(CCNL_NONE);
00057     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "SEVERE"))
00058         return(CCNL_SEVERE);
00059     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "ERROR"))
00060         return(CCNL_ERROR);
00061     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "WARNING"))
00062         return(CCNL_WARNING);
00063     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "INFO"))
00064         return(CCNL_INFO);
00065     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINE"))
00066         return(CCNL_FINE);
00067     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINER"))
00068         return(CCNL_FINER);
00069     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINEST"))
00070         return(CCNL_FINEST);
00071     v = strtol(s, &ep, 10);
00072     if (v > CCNL_FINEST || v < 0 || ep[0] != 0)
00073         return(-1);
00074     return(v);
00075 }

00077 /**
00078  *  Produce ccnr debug output.
00079  *  Output is produced via h->logger under the control of h->debug;
00080  *  prepends decimal timestamp and process identification.
00081  *  Caller should not supply newlines.
00082  *  @param      h  the ccnr handle
00083  *  @param      fmt  printf-like format string
00084  */
00085 void
00086 ccnr_msg(struct ccnr_handle *h, const char *fmt, ...)
00087 {
00088     va_list ap;
00089     va_start(ap, fmt);
00090     ccnr_vmsg(h, fmt, ap);
00091     va_end(ap);
00092 }
00093 
00094 /**
00095  *  Produce ccnr debug output.
00096  *  Output is produced via h->logger under the control of h->debug;
00097  *  prepends decimal timestamp and process identification.
00098  *  Caller should not supply newlines.
00099  *  @param      h  the ccnr handle
00100  *  @param      fmt  printf-like format string
00101  */
00102 void
00103 ccnr_vmsg(struct ccnr_handle *h, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
00104 {
00105     struct timeval t;
00106     struct ccn_charbuf *b;
00107     int res;
00108     time_t clock;
00109     if (h == NULL || h->debug == 0 || h->logger == 0)
00110         return;
00111     b = ccn_charbuf_create();
00112     if (b == NULL)
00113         return;
00114     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00115     if ((h->debug >= CCNL_FINE) &&
00116         ((h->logbreak-- < 0 && t.tv_sec != h->logtime) ||
00117          t.tv_sec >= h->logtime + 30)) {
00118             clock = t.tv_sec;
00119             ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "%ld.000000 ccnr[%d]: %s ____________________ %s",
00120                              (long)t.tv_sec, h->logpid,
00121                              h->portstr ? h->portstr : "",
00122                              ctime(&clock));
00123             h->logtime = t.tv_sec;
00124             h->logbreak = 30;
00125         }
00126     ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "%ld.%06u ccnr[%d]: %s\n",
00127                      (long)t.tv_sec, (unsigned)t.tv_usec, h->logpid, fmt);
00128     /* b should already have null termination, but use call for cleanliness */
00129     res = (*h->logger)(h->loggerdata, ccn_charbuf_as_string(b), ap);
00130     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&b);
00131     /* if there's no one to hear, don't make a sound */
00132     if (res < 0)
00133         h->debug = 0;
00134 }
00135 
00136 /**
00137  *  Produce a ccnr debug trace entry.
00138  *  Output is produced by calling ccnr_msg.
00139  *  @param      h  the ccnr handle
00140  *  @param      lineno  caller's source line number (usually __LINE__)
00141  *  @param      msg  a short text tag to identify the entry
00142  *  @param      fdholder    handle of associated fdholder; may be NULL
00143  *  @param      ccnb    points to ccnb-encoded Interest or ContentObject
00144  *  @param      ccnb_size   is in bytes
00145  */
00146 void
00147 ccnr_debug_ccnb(struct ccnr_handle *h,
00148                 int lineno,
00149                 const char *msg,
00150                 struct fdholder *fdholder,
00151                 const unsigned char *ccnb,
00152                 size_t ccnb_size)
00153 {
00154     struct ccn_charbuf *c;
00155     struct ccn_parsed_interest pi;
00156     const unsigned char *nonce = NULL;
00157     size_t nonce_size = 0;
00158     size_t i;
00159     
00160     
00161     if (h != NULL && h->debug == 0)
00162         return;
00163     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00164     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "debug.%d %s ", lineno, msg);
00165     if (fdholder != NULL)
00166         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%u ", fdholder->filedesc);
00167     ccn_uri_append(c, ccnb, ccnb_size, 1);
00168     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " (%u bytes)", (unsigned)ccnb_size);
00169     if (ccn_parse_interest(ccnb, ccnb_size, &pi, NULL) >= 0) {
00170         const char *p = "";
00171         ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Nonce, ccnb,
00172                   pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_Nonce],
00173                   pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_Nonce],
00174                   &nonce,
00175                   &nonce_size);
00176         if (nonce_size > 0) {
00177             ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " ");
00178             if (nonce_size == 12)
00179                 p = "CCC-P-F-T-NN";
00180             for (i = 0; i < nonce_size; i++)
00181                 ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%s%02X", (*p) && (*p++)=='-' ? "-" : "", nonce[i]);
00182         }
00183     }
00184     ccnr_msg(h, "%s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(c));
00185     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00186 }
